results.title: Flying seeds
results.brief_description: Uses time-lapse photography and close-ups in a study of plant mechanisms for distributing seeds by air. Shows how wind borne seeds and those which scatter, explode or catapult, free themselves from the parent plant and travel through the air.
results.description: Uses time-lapse photography and close-ups in a study of plant mechanisms for distributing seeds by air. Shows how wind borne seeds and those which scatter, explode or catapult, free themselves from the parent plant and travel through the air.

results.title: Flying menace
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes the life cycle of the fruit fly, and the destruction it causes among Australian fruit. Illustrates the precautions being taken by the Department of Agriculture in checking the spread of the menace and shows how farmers should destroy contaminated fruit.

results.title: The Flying man
results.brief_description: An experimental animated film in which one man flies and another man, in an attempt to imitate him, fails. Uses water colors. Story by Stan Hayward and music by Ron Goodwin. (Award: Grand Prix, Annecy Festival, 1963)

results.title: Flying doctor
results.brief_description: A factual film of a unique Australian service: “By aeroplane and radio the Flying Doctor Service and the Commonwealth Air Ambulance Service bring medical aid to the thinly populated areas of Australia’s vast inland. At Broken Hill base, where this film as photographed, Dr John Wood cares for patients in an area of over 500,000 square miles”. Photography by Lionel Trainor.

results.title: The Flying Dane
results.brief_description: This film is about Danish inventor Jacob Christian Ellehammer and his experiments in aviation. Trained as a watchmaker and mechanic, Ellehammer produced the first motorcycle, a musical slot machine and a form of moving picture before turning to aviation. Between 1902 and 1909 he worked on several experimental powered aeroplanes and succeeded in making the first air flight in Europe. Later he worked on a helicopter, motor cars, and invented the fire extinguisher and a steam tractor.

results.title: Fly about the house
results.brief_description: Two flies hatch out and go off in search of food. They first visit a well-kept home; the dustbin is properly covered, the householders wash their hands frequently, the larder door is kept closed and the food in it is well-covered. Baulked here, they go on to a slovenly household, find lots of food lying about, sample it all. One fly goes back to the first house, is sprayed and killed. The other goes on to another dirty house and spreads disease and death An animated film.

results.title: The Flute
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Richard Adeney, British flautist, discusses the development of the flute over ten centuries showing how the number of holes in the body of the instrument gradually increased and how the use of keys led to the complete chromatic scale. Illustrated by excerpts from Schubert, Mozart, Bizet, Tchaikovsky and Gluck.

results.title: The Fluoridation story
results.brief_description: A short film trailer showing that communities can reduce tooth decay by adding sodium fluoride to their water supply. Emphasises the economy and simplicity of doing so.
